# Objectives

- Getting familiar with the course structure
- Setup a computational working environment
- Learn about open source computational tools

# Agenda
## Demos
- Election of a student representative
- Course overview
- Open source tools for computational social science

## Hack Time
### Setting up a computational working environment
- Create a [GitHub Account](https://github.com/)
- Download and Install Git
- Install [R](https://cran.biotools.fr/) version de base 4.0.3
- Install [LaTeX](https://miktex.org/download)
- Install [RStudio](https://rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download)
- Create a [DataCamp] account and join the class!

### Practice with GitHub, Markdown, and RStudio
- Create a GitHub repository with a README.md file.
- Markdown Tutorial
- Edit and add files to GitHub
- Edit GitHub files with RStudio and generate PDF's

## Coding Challenge
- [Challenge 0: The Warm Up!](challenges.html#challenge-0-the-warm-up)

# Requirements

Make sure you have completed the following activities before this first session.

1. Join our [Slack](https://spb-methods.slack.com) channel
2. Download [R](https://cran.biotools.fr/)
3. Download [RStudio](https://rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download)
4. Download [LaTeX](https://miktex.org/download)
5. Create a [GitHub](https://github.com/) account
